Questions.Question: Pinging all IP addresses on a network is referred to as a:
Questions.Explanation: A ping sweep is when a user identifies all hosts active in a network by sending a ping to every IP address in the network.

Answers.Text: Ping sweep
Network ping
IP sweep

Questions.Question: Pinging all IP addresses on a network is an efficient means of identifying active hosts in a network.
Questions.Explanation: Systems on a network may ignore the ping due to firewall settings, causing this technique to fail.

Questions.Question: Which best describes the way Nmap undergoes network mapping?
Questions.Explanation: Nmap initiates a three-way handshake with systems in a network, before purposely not conforming to the TCP standard to get a response from a system.

Answers.Text: By pinging all IP addresses on a network.
By analysing traffic moving across a network to track active hosts.
By initiating a three-way handshake with systems.

Questions.Question: Which of the following can be used to find hosts on LAN?
Questions.Explanation: An ARP scan involves iterating over every IP address on a LAN using the ARP protocol to force a reply from any systems.

Answers.Text: Port scanning
ARP scan
Ping sweep
All of the options.

Questions.Question: Attackers can exploit applications over a network with the help of port scanning.
Questions.Explanation: By determining which ports are open, attackers can determine which services can be connected to. Services may have vulnerabilities that can then be exploited by these attackers.

Questions.Question: Using UDP to port scan is easier than using TCP.
Questions.Explanation: TCP is easier to use when port scanning as if a service is available it will always reply with a SYN/ACK packet. UDP port scanning can often be more difficult as services may require a specific input.

Questions.Question: Which of the following is not true?
Questions.Explanation: UDP port scanning can be slower than TCP port scanning as it may be difficult to get a response from some services.

Answers.Text: TCP port scanning can involve sending a packet to all 65536 ports.
UDP port scanning is faster than TCP port scanning.
If no reply is returned, it can be assumed that the packet was filtered or that the port is closed.
None of the options.

Questions.Question: UDP port scanning can rely on using SYN/ACK packets if no response is received.
Questions.Explanation: As UDP port scanning is performed on UDP ports, the TCP protocol cannot be used when UDP port scanning fails.

Questions.Question: Faster scans have a higher chance of being detected by IDS systems due to their speed.
Questions.Explanation: A fast scan might overwhelm a system, while a slower scan is more likely to go undetected.

Questions.Question: T0 is the fastest speed option for port scanning on Nmap.
Questions.Explanation: T0 is the slowest speed option on Nmap. The fastest port scanning option is T5.

Questions.Question: nmap --top-ports 40 (target) will make Nmap:
Questions.Explanation: nmap --top-ports is used to scan a specified number of most frequently used ports for a chosen protocol.

Answers.Text: Scan the first 40 ports.
Scan the 40 most frequently used ports for the selected protocol.
Scans until 40 open ports are found.
None of the options.

Questions.Question: Which of the following is true?
Questions.Explanation: All of the given options were false.

Answers.Text: Nmap supports timing options spanning from T0 to T10.
UDP port scanning is often better than TCP port scanning due to its specificity.
A host-based firewall is a firewall implemented over a network, as opposed to a system.
None of the options.

Questions.Question: New Network mapping is useful for protecting against cyberattacks as it:
Questions.Explanation: Network mapping protects a network against cyberattacks by revealing exposed hosts on a network, among other things.

Answers.Text: Resolves any vulnerabilities found on a network.
Maps out any vulnerabilities in a network by checking against known cyberattacks.
Reveals potentially exposed hosts on a network.
Both reveals any active hosts on a network and automatically resolves any vulnerabilities.
